Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma-led Team India are currently stationed in Barbados and are gearing up for the Super 8 round.

India take on their neighbours Afghanistan, a team that has grown from strength to strength in the past few years and pose some good threat to the 'Men in Blue' as far as their bowling department is concerned.
The Indian batters have played the Afghanistan players often in the IPL and might read them well.
With the Caribbean tracks favouring the spinners, India need to be at the top of their game to counter the Afghan challenge.
Rohit Sharma mentioned that the group wants to go out and do something special, and it is a good way to start the second stage of the tournament.
Rohit Sharma also stated that playing the next two games in a span of 3 or 4 days is going to be hectic, but the team is used to this.

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) posted a video on their social media handle which showcases the Indian team slowly getting into the groove and sweating it out in the training nets before they start their Super 8 round.
Rinku Singh, a travelling reserve in the squad, was seen rolling his arm over in the Team India nets.
